oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Failure behavior of plain weave fabric laminates under on-axis uniaxial tensile loading .3. Effect of fabric geometry
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GANESH, VK
NAIK, NK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: elastic behavior
composites
woven fabric composite
plain weave fabric laminate
weave geometry
strand width
strand thickness
inter-strand gap
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of fabric geometry on the failure behavior of two-dimensional orthogonal plain weave fabric laminates under on-axis uniaxial static tensile loading has been investigated using the two-dimensional woven fabric composite strength model. The weave geometrical parameters considered are: strand width, strand thickness and interstrand gap and the corresponding fiber volume fractions. The studies were carried out for three idealized laminate configurations. It was observed that there is a significant effect of weave geometrical parameters on the failure behavior.
